results.title: TikTok Sues U.S. Government Over Law Forcing Sale or Ban
results.abstract: The social media company and its Chinese parent, ByteDance, sued to challenge the new law, saying it violated users’ First Amendment rights.
results.byline: By Sapna Maheshwari and David McCabe

multimedia.caption: TikTok’s office in Culver City, Calif. The company has said a new U.S. law requiring its sale is essentially a ban.
multimedia.copyright: Rozette Rago for The New York Times

results.title: Behind Nigeria’s Arrest of Binance Employee, Claims of a Bribe Request
results.abstract: A compliance officer for the cryptocurrency exchange told senior executives and Nigerian contacts that the company had been asked to pay $150 million in crypto.
results.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany and Emily Flitter

multimedia.caption: Tigran Gambaryan, right, a Binance employee, in a Nigerian courtroom on April 4. He was jailed during a trip to Nigeria in February.

results.title: OpenAI Releases ‘Deepfake’ Detector to Disinformation Researchers
results.abstract: The prominent A.I. start-up is also joining an industrywide effort to spot content made with artificial intelligence.
results.byline: By Cade Metz and Tiffany Hsu

multimedia.caption: OpenAI’s offices in San Francisco. The company said that its new detector can identify 98.8 percent of images created by DALL-E 3, its own generator.
multimedia.copyright: Jim Wilson/The New York Times

results.abstract: The London-based developer of artificial intelligence systems for self-driving vehicles raised the funding from SoftBank, Nvidia, Microsoft and others.

results.title: Reddit Posts $575 Million Loss Tied to I.P.O. but Also Strong Growth
results.abstract: Reddit’s first earnings report as a public company showed leaps in users and advertising revenue, along with expenses related to its initial public offering.

multimedia.caption: The New York Stock Exchange on Reddit’s first day of trading in March. On Tuesday, the company reported a 48 percent increase in quarterly revenue.

results.title: Read TikTok’s legal challenge
results.abstract: TikTok filed a challenge to a law forcing its parent company, ByteDance, to sell the app or face its ban in the United States.

results.title: A New Diplomatic Strategy Emerges as Artificial Intelligence Grows
results.abstract: The new U.S. approach to cyberthreats comes as early optimism about a “global internet” connecting the world has been shattered.

multimedia.caption: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken at the RSA Conference in San Francisco on Monday. He has described an increasingly zero-sum competition, in which countries will be forced to choose between signing up for a Western-dominated “stack” of technologies or a Chinese-dominated one.
multimedia.copyright: Jeff Chiu/Associated Press

multimedia.caption: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken at the RSA Conference in San Francisco on Monday. He has described an increasingly zero-sum competition, in which countries will be forced to choose between signing up for a Western-dominated “stack” of technologies or a Chinese-dominated one.
multimedia.copyright: Jeff Chiu/Associated Press

multimedia.caption: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken at the RSA Conference in San Francisco on Monday. He has described an increasingly zero-sum competition, in which countries will be forced to choose between signing up for a Western-dominated “stack” of technologies or a Chinese-dominated one.

results.title: Is Your Law Firm Using A.I.? Tell Us How.
results.abstract: We want to hear from lawyers using generative A.I. to better understand how firms incorporate or train the technology.

results.abstract: The market for shares of hot start-ups like SpaceX and Stripe is projected to reach a record $64 billion this year.

results.title: Tesla Pullback Puts Onus on Others to Build Electric Vehicle Chargers
results.abstract: The automaker led by Elon Musk is no longer planning to take the lead in expanding the number of places to fuel electric vehicles. It’s not clear how quickly other companies will fill the gap.
results.byline: By Jack Ewing and Ivan Penn

multimedia.caption: Tesla’s change of direction is likely to delay construction of fast chargers, which are concentrated on the two coasts and in parts of Texas.
multimedia.copyright: Lauren Justice for The New York Times

results.title: Final Arguments in Google Antitrust Trial Conclude, Setting Up Landmark Ruling
results.abstract: Judge Amit P. Mehta must now decide whether Google violated the law, potentially setting a precedent for a series of tech monopoly cases.
results.byline: By David McCabe and Cecilia Kang

multimedia.caption: The Justice Department and state attorneys general say that Google has abused a monopoly over the search business, stifling competitors and limiting innovation, something the company denies.
multimedia.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.abstract: With the company facing a ban in the U.S., Shou Chew is expected to join Zendaya, Bad Bunny and Anna Wintour on the red carpet.
results.byline: By Jacob Bernstein, Madison Malone Kircher and Sapna Maheshwari

results.title: TikTok Tells Advertisers: ‘We Are Not Backing Down’
results.abstract: Hundreds of marketers and ad agency types flocked to TikTok’s annual sales presentation after a new law put its future in question.

results.title: A.I. at Your Jobs + Hank Green Talks TikTok + Deepfake High School

results.title: U.S. Antitrust Case Against Google Is Just the Start
results.abstract: As the Justice Department’s case against Google nears an end, the federal government has more suits in the pipeline trying to rein in Big Tech.

results.title: Judge Grills U.S. and Google on Antitrust Claims
results.abstract: Judge Amit P. Mehta tried poking holes in the closing arguments of a landmark monopoly case as he weighs a ruling that could reshape tech.

results.title: Campus Protests Give Russia, China and Iran Fuel to Exploit U.S. Divide
results.abstract: America’s adversaries have mounted online campaigns to amplify the social and political conflicts over Gaza flaring at universities, researchers say.
results.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Tiffany Hsu

multimedia.caption: A protester with a Palestinian flag on a Columbia University building on Monday. So far, there is little evidence that U.S. adversaries have provided material or organizational support to the protests.
multimedia.copyright: Amir Hamja/The New York Times

results.title: Strongest U.S. Challenge to Big Tech’s Power Nears Climax in Google Trial
results.abstract: The first tech monopoly trial of the modern internet era is concluding. The judge’s ruling is likely to set a precedent for other attempts to rein in the tech giants that hold sway over information, social interaction and commerce.

multimedia.caption: At the heart of the case in federal court in Washington is Google’s dominance in online search, which generates billions of dollars in profits annually.

results.title: Meet the Men Who Eat Meat (and Only Meat)
results.abstract: With the help of Joe Rogan, a social media trend with staying power emerged from a 2018 book, “The Carnivore Diet.”

results.title: ‘Smartphones on Wheels’ Draw Attention From Regulators
results.abstract: Modern cars are internet-connected and have hundreds of sensors. Lawmakers and regulators have concerns about what’s happening with all that data.

results.title: Killer Asteroid Hunters Spot 27,500 Overlooked Space Rocks
results.abstract: With the help of Google Cloud, scientists churned through hundreds of thousands of images of the night sky to reveal that the solar system is filled with unseen objects.

multimedia.caption: An algorithm and cloud computing identified overlooked space rocks. Most, in green, are in the main asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter, but other items in orange share Jupiter’s orbit, and items in light blue are closer to Earth.
multimedia.copyright: B612 Asteroid Institute/University of Washington DiRAC Institute/OpenSpace Project

multimedia.caption: An algorithm and cloud computing identified overlooked space rocks. Most, in green, are in the main asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter, but other items in orange share Jupiter’s orbit, and items in light blue are closer to Earth.
multimedia.copyright: B612 Asteroid Institute/University of Washington DiRAC Institute/OpenSpace Project

results.title: Getir, a Rapid Grocery-Delivery Service, Exits the U.S. and Europe
results.abstract: The company had expanded quickly to keep ahead of rivals, but like other pandemic darlings, its business lost steam after lockdowns were eased.

multimedia.caption: At its height, the privately held Getir was valued at nearly $12 billion after expanding quickly, buying up competitors and operating in nine countries.
multimedia.copyright: Suzie Howell for The New York Times

results.title: Women on Bumble No Longer Have to Make the First Move
results.abstract: As dissatisfaction with online dating grows, the app that put women in control is shifting course.

multimedia.caption: Since Bumble launched a decade ago, men had to wait for women on the app to make the first move. Not anymore.
